- Missing lang attribute on the <html> element (WCAG 3.1.1).  
- 1 of 2 links have vague text (e.g. “More info”) (WCAG 1.3.1).  
- 4 of 4 form inputs missing associated <label> elements (WCAG 3.2.2).  
- Missing “Skip to main content” link for keyboard users (WCAG 2.4.1).  
- Color contrast (text vs. background) needs inspection via CSS (WCAG 1.4.3).  
- Touch target sizes require CSS analysis for 2.5.8 compliance.

AI Analysis Insights & Recommendations:
- Define <html lang="en"> to ensure screen readers use correct language.  
- Replace vague link text (“More info”) with descriptive phrases (e.g. “More about The Nucleus: Student Hub”).  
- Provide <label> tags for all form controls (the search field, radio switches, and buttons).  
- Add a “Skip to main content” link as the first focusable element.  
- Review CSS color definitions and ensure a 4.5:1 contrast ratio for text.  
- Ensure interactive elements meet minimum touch target size (44×44 CSS pixels).

https://unswfounders.com/.agent_response: Here are the accessibility analysis results for https://unswfounders.com/: Automated WCAG Compliance (Score: 75/100, Grade AA) Issues found: - HTML lang attribute: Missing lang attribute on `` (WCAG 3.1.1) - Page title: Missing or empty `` element (WCAG 2.4.2) - Single H1: Found 0 `<h1>` tags, should be exactly 1 (WCAG 2.4.6) - Skip link: Missing “Skip to Content” link (WCAG 2.4.1) AI-Powered Insights & Recommendations - Add `lang="en"` (or appropriate language) to the `<html>` element for proper localization and screen reader language switching. - Include a concise, descriptive `<title>` tag in `<head>` for context in browser tabs and assistive devices. - Ensure exactly one `<h1>` per page (e.g., “UNSW Founders”) and use nested `<h2>–<h6>` for subheadings to establish a clear content hierarchy. - Add a “Skip to Content” link at the top (e.g., `<a href="#main" class="skip-link">Skip to main content</a>`) that becomes visible on focus, allowing keyboard users to bypass repetitive navigation. ` or ARIA landmarks (`role="navigation"`, `role="main"`) to provide a page map to assistive tools. 4. Keyboard users – verify that carousels, dropdowns and pop-overs are reachable, operable with Tab/Enter/Escape, and that focus is trapped or returned appropriately. 5. Images & media – all decorative images should have empty `alt=""`; informative images and icons must carry descriptive alt text, or use `aria-hidden="true"` on purely decorative SVGs. 6. Dynamic content – ensure content that appears (e.g. “more” toggle, gallery tabs) is announced to screen readers via ARIA or appropriate DOM updates (e.g. `aria-expanded`, `aria-controls`). 7. Color contrast – maintain at least 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text and UI graphics. Include focus ring colors in contrast checks. 8.
